intro: Orthosiphon violaceus, commonly known as purple senna, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers, which bloom in clusters along the stems. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Orthosiphon violaceus is also valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
